content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The images show two views of the Audience Hall (apadana) of Darius and Xerxes in Persepolis, Iran, built c. 520–465 B.C.E. Describe at least one visual characteristic of the Audience Hall (apadana) of Darius and Xerxes. Describe at least one function of the Audience Hall (apadana) of Darius and Xerxes. Using two pieces of specific evidence, explain how the design and/or sculptural program of the Audience Hall (apadana) of Darius and Xerxes were influenced by the historical context of the ancient Persian Empire. Using specific evidence, explain why the sculptural program of the Audience Hall (apadana) of Darius and Xerxes can be interpreted as expressing the power of the ancient Persian Empire.
